metricspace.model.calculate_spkd package¶

Submodules¶

metricspace.model.calculate_spkd.spkd_functions module¶

metricspace.distance.calculate_spkd.calculate_spkd.py

Contains internal spike distance calculation functions. These functions are called by the public functions in metricspace.distance.spkd.py and metricspace.distance.spkd_slide.py.

They are private to clean up the public namespace, avoid circular imports, and prevent confusion about which spike distance function is being called.

metricspace.model.calculate_spkd.spkd_functions.calculate_spkd(cspks: ndarray | list, qvals: list | ndarray, res: float | int | None = 0.01)[source]¶

Internal function to compute pairwise spike train distances with variable time precision for multiple cost values.

Parameters:

  • cspks (nested iterable[list | np.ndarray]) – Each inner list contains spike times for a single spike train.

  • qvals (list of float | int) – List of time precision values to use in the computation.

  • res (float, optional) – The search resolution of the spike trains. Defaults to 1e-4.

Returns:

A 3D array containing pairwise spike train distances for each time precision value.

Return type:

ndarray

Raises:

TypeError: If cspks is not a list or numpy array.

Module contents¶

Internal function to compute pairwise spike train distances with variable time precision for multiple cost values.
